Description: We will discuss the various mechanisms through which founder mutations that disrupt chromatin and transcriptional mechanisms that are highly recurrent B-cell lymphomas drive the formation of aberrant immunological niches and the trajectories through which these clonal precursor cells could become fully transformed.   We will review critical lessons learned from animal models of these tumors, and discuss how such models could be harnessed for the purpose of performing physiologically accurate experimental therapeutics studies. We will discuss how these insights could lead to therapeutic regimens aimed to maximize efficacy of immunotherapy approaches through combinatorial therapies using precision molecular targeted therapies
